text.0: agni who knowest all accept our offering and the cake of meal.
text.1: at dawns libation rich in prayer.
text.2: agni the sacrificial cake hath been prepared and dressed for thee.
text.3: accept it o most youthful god.
text.4: agni enjoy the cake of meal and our oblation three days old.
text.5: thou son of strength art stablished at our sacrifice.
text.6: here at the midday sacrifice enjoy thou the sacrificial cake wise jātavedas.
text.7: agni the sages in assemblies never minish the portion due to thee the mighty.
text.8: o agni at the third libation takewith joy the offered cake of sacrifice thou son of strength.
text.9: through skill in song bear to the gods our sacrifice watchful and fraught with riches to immortal god.
text.10: o waxing agni knower thou of all accept our gifts the cake.
